meanings.sent1: The box can contain all the toys.
meanings.sent2: The jar contains candies for the party.
meanings.sent3: I tried to contain my excitement, but I couldn't help jumping up and down.
meanings.sent4: Her heart seemed to contain an endless amount of love for everyone she met.
meanings.sent5: The dam struggled to contain the raging river, but eventually, it burst.

meanings.definition: To include as a part of a whole
meanings.sent1: The book will contain all the information you need.
meanings.sent2: The recipe contains a secret ingredient that makes it special.
meanings.sent3: The surprise party will contain all our friends to celebrate together.
meanings.sent4: His speech contained wise advice that everyone should follow.
meanings.sent5: The treasure chest will contain riches beyond imagination.

meanings.sent1: She struggled to contain her laughter during the serious meeting.
meanings.sent2: It's important to contain your anger and think before reacting.
meanings.sent3: The comedian couldn't contain his jokes and made everyone burst into laughter.
meanings.sent4: The teacher tried to contain the noisy classroom by using a bell.
meanings.sent5: The superhero had to contain the villain's destructive powers to save the city.

meanings.definition: To be capable of holding or storing
meanings.sent1: The container can contain all the water we need for the trip.
meanings.sent2: The warehouse contains a variety of products ready for shipment.
meanings.sent3: The fridge couldn't contain all the groceries, so we had to get a bigger one.
meanings.sent4: The bag was able to contain all the books she needed for school.
meanings.sent5: The memory card can contain thousands of photos from your vacation.
